Summary: “I wouldn’t touch the Major Arcana.” Arthur startled, nearly dropping the cards. He whirled around to the voice. “They get twitchy.”An ornamental crystal ball fell onto the floor behind him, shattering into millions of tiny pieces.Behind him was a man, probably near Arthur’s age. He registered the wide, bright eyes, pale skin, and dark hair. Arthur hadn’t heard him approach. Where did he come from?“The—” Arthur’s eyes jumped back to the magician card, “Major Arcana?”That sounded sort of... magicky“Yes, yes, they get so full of themselves.” The man’s lips twitched, and Arthur was inexplicably drawn to the hint of his grin. Or, a lot can happen when you take cover under a random shop's awning. Mostly, Arthur just wants to figure out why 'The Magician' card is always his future.

entry.title: The Shape of What Was Promised
entry.summary:
Author: slothsofthevoid

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,763Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: In Camelot, secrets are a form of survival. When Morgana begins to fear the magic awakening within her, Merlin becomes her quiet anchor ⎯ teaching control where others would offer condemnation. As the kingdom tightens its laws against sorcery, Arthur begins to notice the impossible patterns surrounding his servant: acts of loyalty that defy reason, courage that borders on prophecy, and a devotion that costs Merlin more than anyone ever sees. Love, too, must be hidden. Between prince and servant, between king and sorcerer, it exists unspoken ⎯ known only in stolen moments and unguarded silences. Destiny, however, does not yield to secrecy. Some promies are kept only after the one who made them is gone.
